text: The 1977–78 Coppa Italia was the 31st Coppa Italia, the major Italian domestic cup. The competition was won by Internazionale, who defeated Napoli in a one- legged final played at the Stadio Olimpico in Rome. == First round == === Group 1 === === Group 2 === === Group 3 === === Group 4 === === Group 5 === === Group 6 === === Group 7 === Play-off match {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center" !Team 1 !Agg. !Team 2 !1st leg !2nd leg |- | bgcolor="ccffcc" |Taranto |3-2 |Pescara |2-2 |1-0 |} == Second round == Join the defending champion: Milan. === Group A === === Group B === ==Final== == Top goalscorers == {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Player !Club !Goals |- |1 | align="left" |' Giuseppe Savoldi | align="left" |Napoli |12 |- |2 | align="left" |' Giovanni Sartori | align="left" |Milan |5 |- | rowspan="9" |3 | align="left" |' Alessandro Altobelli | align="left" |Internazionale | rowspan="9" |4 |- | align="left" |' Carlo Muraro | align="left" |Internazionale |- | align="left" |' Pietro Anastasi | align="left" |Internazionale |- | align="left" |' Oscar Damiani | align="left" |Genoa |- | align="left" | Bruno Nobili | align="left" |Pescara |- | align="left" |' Paolo Pulici | align="left" |Torino |- | align="left" |' Claudio Desolati | align="left" |Fiorentina |- | align="left" |' Enio Fiaschi | align="left" |Hellas Verona |- | align="left" |' Aldo Cantarutti | align="left" |Monza |} ==References== *rsssf.com Category:Coppa Italia seasons Coppa
title: 1977–78 Coppa Italia
